title: Moving blockchain folder to virtualbox shared folder causes: Synchronisation failed: fsync: invalid argument
body:
Since the blockchain is much bigger than anticipated with a new crypto project i was about to run out of diskspace on my ubuntu 14 virtualbox instance while syncing.

I decided to create a shared folder in virtualbox, copied the blockchain folder to it and created a symlink in the original .ethereum folder pointing to the copied blockchain folder.

```
john@john-VirtualBox:~$ ls -al .ethereum/
total 28
drwx------  5 john john 4096 feb 24 11:01 .
drwxr-xr-x 16 john john 4096 feb 24 10:45 ..
lrwxrwxrwx  1 john john   38 feb 24 11:01 chaindata -> /media/sf_ethereum/.ethereum/chaindata
drwxr-xr-x  2 john john 4096 feb 24 11:01 dapp
srw-------  1 john john    0 feb 24 11:01 geth.ipc
-rwxrwxr-x  1 john john  818 feb 24 11:18 history
drwx------  2 john john 4096 feb 23 13:58 keystore
-rw-------  1 john john   64 feb 23 14:03 nodekey
drwxr-xr-x  2 john john 4096 feb 24 11:01 nodes
```

next i restarted geth and got this:

```
I0224 11:02:02.415310    3608 blockchain.go:1243] imported 2 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 3 txs in 1.63651497s. #771485 [7e52be3d / b8040d03]
I0224 11:02:14.403357    3608 downloader.go:267] Synchronisation failed: fsync: invalid argument
I0224 11:02:34.297227    3608 downloader.go:267] Synchronisation failed: fsync: invalid argument

I0224 11:04:16.685419    3608 downloader.go:267] Synchronisation failed: fsync: invalid argument
```

is this a virtualbox specific io problem?
This seems to be an issue with the file system used for shared folders by VirtualBox. We cannot fix this issue, sorry, you'll have to find some other way.
